entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Another Elon Musk Company to Accept Dogecoin and 3AC's Founders Might Be AWOL
entry.summary: Elsewhere, the personal information of more than a billion people was leaked from a Shanghai police database.

entry.title: The Crypto Bailouts Have Begun. Is This the Only Way?
entry.summary: SBF is rescuing insolvent crypto companies left and right. Now CZ and Justin Sun want in. None of this is very healthy for the industry.

entry.title: The Next Big Thing in NFTs: Selling Them for Peanuts
entry.summary: The pitch to fans: Support music or art out of goodwill, in exchange for a sense of ownership or patronage.

entry.title: Chelsea Manning Talks Crypto, Privacy, and Security
entry.summary: Chelsea Manning, who gave classified documents regarding the wars in Afghanistan and Iraq to WikiLeaks in 2010, talked to Decrypt's Stacy Elliott about crypto and privacy, decentralization and government, and her work with Nym.

entry.title: 'Opening Our Arms': Polygon Studios CEO on Rescuing Terra Projects
entry.summary: Terra's collapse wiped out billions of dollars in value. It also left dozens of projects homeless.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin and Ethereum Rebound Despite Vauld and Voyager Woes
entry.summary: Although the industry appears mired in crypto winter, most top cryptocurrencies posted weekly gains.

entry.title: How Celsius Is Scrambling to Wind Down Its DeFi Activity
entry.summary: A close look at wallet data on ApeBoard shows how Celsius is scrambling to wind down DeFi debt. Will it help, or simply delay the inevitable?

entry.title: Argentinian Crypto Exchange Ripio to Launch Ethereum Sidechain, Web3 Wallet
entry.summary: Looking to increase user engagement, the company is also launching a book and promoting events.

entry.title: State Regulators Intensify Scrutiny of Voyager: Report
entry.summary: Regulators are digging deeper into past dealings of the embattled crypto exchange.

entry.title: After Bitcoin Wash Trading Surges on Binance, CEO Nixes Incentives
entry.summary: Users reportedly exploited Binance’s lack of fees on Bitcoin spot trades to earn VIP perks for fake high-volume trades.

entry.title: Elon Musk Cancels Twitter Purchase Agreement
entry.summary: After weeks of waffling, the Tesla and SpaceX CEO is attempting to break his agreement to buy the social media platform.

entry.title: Chelsea Manning’s Reluctant Return to Crypto and Renewed Passion for Privacy
entry.summary: "There are pitfalls to not having this kind of technology," Manning told Decrypt about the importance of projects like Nym's mixnet.

entry.title: Fed Vice Chair Calls for More Crypto Regulation, Notes Terra Collapse
entry.summary: Crypto does not yet pose a "systemic risk," but now is the time to ensure that it doesn't happen, says the Fed's Lael Brainard.

entry.title: Tether Says It Liquidated a Bitcoin Loan Made to Crypto Lender Celsius
entry.summary: The stablecoin issuer says that the loan was overcollateralized and was liquidated in a way that "minimized" impact on the market.

entry.title: What Is Aave? Inside the DeFi Lending Protocol
entry.summary: DeFi protocol Aave is one of the largest lenders of cryptocurrency and its AAVE token has a larger market cap than rivals Maker or Compound. Here's how it works.

entry.title: Celsius Lost $350M of Client Funds From ‘High-Risk’ Levered Trading: Arkham Report
entry.summary: Arkham said that losses incurred by 0xb1 could've left the lending platform "short of its customers' deposited assets, let alone the interest it guaranteed them."

entry.title: DeFi Tokens Aave, Lido Rally Alongside Ethereum Recovery
entry.summary: Several DeFi tokens, including Aave and Lido, have shown strong gains following increased on-chain user activity.

entry.title: Binance Continues European Expansion With New Crypto Registration in Spain
entry.summary: After France and Italy, Spain becomes the third European Union country to have registered Binance as a digital asset provider.

entry.title: FDIC to Investigate Bankrupt Voyager Digital’s Insurance Claims
entry.summary: The FDIC is probing crypto firm Voyager for allegedly duping customers with its Metropolitan Commercial Bank Insurance.

entry.title: KeyFi CEO Behind 0xb1 Twitter Account Sues Celsius for 'Ponzi Scheme'
entry.summary: The self-doxxed DeFi entrepreneur Jason Stone alleges that Celsius used customer funds to manipulate markets.

entry.title: Bitcoin Climbs 6%, Ethereum Jumps 7% As Markets Go Green
entry.summary: Bitcoin has risen 15% and Ethereum 22% in the past week. Is the market downturn coming to an end?

entry.title: Bitcoin Mining Company Compass Cuts Staff by 15%
entry.summary: The downsizing and executive pay cuts follow high-level resignations and claims that the company failed to pay its bills.

entry.title: 'Stolen' Bored Ape and Mutant Ape Ethereum NFTs Now Total Over $18.5M
entry.summary: Azuki, CloneX, and Moonbirds add another $6.9 million to the tally of NFTs “reported for suspicious activity” on OpenSea.

entry.title: Binance CEO CZ on Sam Bankman-Fried's Voyager Bailout: ‘I Would Never Do That Type of Deal’
entry.summary: In an interview for Decrypt's gm podcast, CZ laid out Binance's approach to "bailouts" and critiqued Alameda's lifeline to Voyager.

entry.title: Binance CEO CZ on Crypto Bailouts and the Deals He Would Not Do
entry.summary: In an interview for Decrypt's gm podcast, CZ laid out Binance's approach to "bailouts" amid the crypto liquidity crunch, and criticized Alameda's complicated lifeline to Voyager.

entry.title: How Solana, Polygon and HTC’s New Crypto Phones Compare
entry.summary: Blockchain phones are back. Here’s how crypto and tech firms are approaching their latest mobile Web3 projects.

entry.title: Dump Incoming? Celsius Pays Back Maker Loan, Moves $440M in Wrapped Bitcoin to FTX
entry.summary: After withdrawing its WBTC, the company added the recently released collateral to its FTX wallet. It now has $531M on the exchange.

entry.title: DeFi Giant Aave Wants to Launch Its Own Stablecoin
entry.summary: The proposal now goes to the Aave DAO for a vote.

entry.title: Republican Sen. Lummis: Democrat Sen. Gillibrand Is Teaching Me About NFTs
entry.summary: Senator Lummis said on Decrypt’s gm podcast that she's been learning about NFTs from her crypto bill partner across the aisle, Senator Gillibrand.

entry.title: Buy a Bored Ape Now and Pay Later With New Service for Ethereum NFTs
entry.summary: Teller’s Polygon-based platform will let users make a down payment and take a loan to buy “blue chip” Ethereum NFTs.

entry.title: Reddit to Launch NFT Avatars Built on Polygon
entry.summary: Reddit's Polygon-based NFTs are just the latest crypto move from one of the Internet’s largest social platforms.

entry.title: Majority of Ethereum 2.0 Stakers Underwater as Bear Market Continues
entry.summary: As the price of ETH plunged more than 78% from its November all-time high, only 17% of Ethereum 2.0 stakers are currently in profit.

entry.title: Genesis Joins List of Firms That Liquidated Three Arrows Capital
entry.summary: Genesis CEO Michael Moro has confirmed that the crypto platform did indeed have exposure to troubled hedge fund Three Arrows Capital.

entry.title: Argo Blockchain the Latest Crypto Mining Firm to Dump Bitcoin
entry.summary: After selling $15.6 million in Bitcoin, Argo is the second crypto miner this week to announce it sold more coin than it mined last month.

entry.title: Developers Behind Shiba Inu Tease Launch of New Stablecoin, Reward Token
entry.summary: Popular meme coin Shiba Inu sets sights on expanding its ecosystem with a decentralized stablecoin and a new reward token.

entry.title: Trio of JP Morgan Execs Leave For Crypto Jobs
entry.summary: The storied financial firm, slow to warm to crypto, is losing top talent to Web3 despite the bear market.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried's Alameda Research Owes Bankrupt Voyager $377M
entry.summary: The crypto trading firm founded by SBF is Voyager Digital's second-largest borrower after Three Arrows Capital, according to a Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing.

entry.title: Bitstamp Scraps Plan for Inactivity Fees After Users Revolt
entry.summary: The proposed 10-euro monthly fee on non-U.S. customers was not well received.

entry.title: Elon Musk's Boring Company Will Accept Dogecoin for Las Vegas Loop
entry.summary: Musk responded to reports of the announcement by saying he’s “supporting Doge wherever possible.”

entry.title: Worst of Crypto Crisis Has Passed: FTX CEO
entry.summary: 30-year-old billionaire Sam Bankman-Fried nonetheless admitted that the crash was “a fair bit worse” than he expected.

entry.title: Ethereum Merge Moves One Step Closer Following Sepolia Trial Run
entry.summary: Just one more testnet merge to go, say developers.

entry.title: Toronto Stock Exchange Suspends Trading of Voyager Digital
entry.summary: The company’s shares declined by 27% in the five trading days leading up to the announcement.

entry.title: gm: Senator Cynthia Lummis Is Fighting for Bitcoin
entry.summary: Wyoming Sen. Cynthia Lummis, the "Bitcoin Senator," joined Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott on the gm podcast to talk about the Lummis-Gillibrand crypto regulation bill, the need for clearer policy on crypto in DC, and converting crypto skeptics—plus her take on the bear market and NFTs. Make sure to subscribe to the podcast.

entry.title: Lolli Bitcoin Shopping App CEO at NFT NYC: NFTs 'Captured the Zeitgeist'
entry.summary: Alex Adelman, CEO of Bitcoin shopping rewards app Lolli, talked to Decrypt's Andrew Hayward at NFT NYC about why NFTs have impressed him and why he's "kind of sad" because Bitcoin "should have captured" the cultural moment that Ethereum and NFTs did.

entry.title: NFT NYC: How Dequency Is Using Blockchain to Decentralize Music Usage Rights
entry.summary: Just ahead of a live event during NFT NYC from BeetsDAO and Decrypt, Margaret Link and Keatly Haldeman of Dequency talk to Decrypt EIC Dan Roberts about how their company is using the Algorand blockchain to de-bug the decades-old process of music synchronization rights.

entry.title: The Bill Murray 1,000 NFT Project Reveal Trailer
entry.summary: A first look at actor Bill Murray's upcoming Ethereum NFT project with The Chive and Project Venkman.

entry.title: gm: Meet 'Move to Earn' NFT App Stepn
entry.summary: Stepn is the talk of Crypto Twitter: an app that rewards you in crypto for exercising outdoors. But first you have to buy a pricey sneaker NFT. Stepn CMO Shiti Manghani joined the gm podcast to talk about how the app works, its GST and GMT tokens, Stepn's recent decision regarding China, and why the future for NFTs is utility.

entry.title: NFTs and Knife-Throwing Abound at Superchief Gallery in LA
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin talks to Superchief Gallery co-founder Edward Ed Zipco about NFTs and the potential for digital art at Superchief's 10 anniversary showing in Los Angeles.

entry.title: #DecryptLive: Luxury Fashion Brands Are Going Crypto
entry.summary: From Dolce & Gabbana to Balmain, big names in fashion are embracing crypto and NFTs. Decrypt's Stephen Graves, Dan Roberts, Sander Lutz and contributor Alys Keys discuss the trend.

entry.title: Collateralized Monkey JPEGs: CEO of Arcade Talks to Decrypt at Consensus
entry.summary: Arcade, an NFT liquidity provider, says it's facilitating $25 million in loans against blue-chip NFTs like Bored Apes. Arcade CEO Gabe Frank talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Consensus 2022.

entry.title: Decrypt Learn: What is a Dapp?
entry.summary: A dapp is a decentralized app built on blockchains to give you more ownership and freedom in your digital life. Dapps are the next generation of software. Explore the vast selection of dapps on Ethereum today. Curious how to build dapps? Start building free at infura.io.

entry.title: Bringing 'Snow Crash' to Life: Neal Stephenson Talks to Decrypt at Consensus
entry.summary: Neal Stephenson, who coined the term "metaverse" in his seminal novel "Snow Crash," speaks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson along with Bitcoin Foundation founder Peter Vessenes, about the new "free metaverse" they're co-launching, Lamina1.
